description: Explore scientific developments from the 19th century to today

slides.title: Welcome to Modern Science
slides.content:
# Introduction to Modern Science

Welcome to **Modern Science** - the last 200 years!

## What You Will Learn:
- **19th Century** - Darwin, thermodynamics, electromagnetism
- **20th Century** - Relativity, quantum, DNA
- **21st Century** - Current frontiers

> **Fun Fact:** More scientists are alive today than have ever lived in all of human history!

slides.title: 19th Century
slides.content:
# 19th Century

## Major Developments:

| Field | Discovery |
|-------|----------|
| Biology | Evolution (Darwin) |
| Chemistry | Periodic table (Mendeleev) |
| Physics | Electromagnetism (Maxwell) |
| Physics | Thermodynamics |
| Medicine | Germ theory (Pasteur, Koch) |

## Darwin (1809-1882):
- Origin of Species (1859)
- Natural selection
- Common descent

## Maxwell (1831-1879):
- Unified electricity and magnetism
- Light is electromagnetic wave

slides.title: 20th Century Physics
slides.content:
# 20th Century Physics

## Einstein (1879-1955):

| Theory | Significance |
|--------|-------------|
| Special Relativity | E = mc^2 |
| General Relativity | Gravity = curved spacetime |
| Photoelectric | Light is particles too |

## Quantum Mechanics:
- Planck: Energy quanta (1900)
- Bohr: Atomic model (1913)
- Heisenberg: Uncertainty (1927)
- Schrodinger: Wave equation

## Nuclear Physics:
- Rutherford: Nucleus (1911)
- Fission discovered (1938)
- Manhattan Project
- Particle physics: Standard Model

slides.title: 20th Century Life Sciences
slides.content:
# 20th Century Life Sciences

## DNA:
- Watson & Crick: Structure (1953)
- Double helix
- Genetic code

## Molecular Biology:
- Central dogma: DNA -> RNA -> Protein
- Genetic engineering

## Medicine:
- Antibiotics (penicillin, 1928)
- Vaccines
- Imaging (X-ray, MRI, CT)

## Computers:
- Electronic computers (1940s)
- Transistors (1947)
- Integrated circuits (1958)
- Internet (1990s)

slides.title: 21st Century and Beyond
slides.content:
# 21st Century Science

## Current Frontiers:

| Field | Frontier |
|-------|----------|
| Physics | Dark matter, dark energy |
| Biology | Gene editing (CRISPR) |
| Medicine | Personalized medicine |
| Computing | Quantum computers, AI |
| Astronomy | Exoplanets, James Webb |

## Recent Achievements:
- Higgs boson (2012)
- Gravitational waves (2015)
- Black hole image (2019)
- CRISPR therapies
- COVID vaccines (mRNA)

slides.title: Summary
slides.content:
# Modern Science Summary

## 19th Century:
- Evolution, electromagnetism, germ theory

## 20th Century:
| Field | Revolution |
|-------|------------|
| Physics | Relativity, quantum |
| Biology | DNA, molecular biology |
| Technology | Computers, space |

## 21st Century:
- CRISPR, AI, gravitational waves
- Big data, interdisciplinary research

> **Congratulations!** You've completed Modern Science!
